meanings.sent1: After their argument, they spent time reconciling and apologizing to each other.
meanings.sent2: She is good at reconciling conflicts and helping people get along.

meanings.definition: To make (one account) consistent with another.
meanings.sent1: He spent hours reconciling the numbers in the financial report to ensure accuracy.
meanings.sent2: The accountant is skilled at reconciling discrepancies in the company's records.
meanings.sent3: The computer program was like a reconciling wizard, magically fixing all the errors in the data.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like a reconciling machine, quickly aligning all the information into a coherent whole.
meanings.sent5: The puzzle pieces were finally reconciling, fitting perfectly together to reveal the complete picture.
